Material used.Material Name: Fibroblasts from Leigh syndrome patients and healthy controls
Material used.Description: Protein expression was analyzed in fibroblasts from Leigh syndrome patients with the p.Arg154Trp variant and healthy controls.

Readout description.Result Description: Reduced NDUFAF1 protein levels (50% of wild-type) in fibroblasts with the p.Arg154Trp variant.
No detectable NDUFAF1 protein in fibroblasts with the p.Tyr154* variant.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent fibroblast cultures were analyzed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each Western blot experiment was repeated three times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type fibroblasts were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Lysates from HEK293 cells transfected with an empty vector were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test was used.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: NDUFAF1 protein expression ≥ 80% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: NDUFAF1 protein expression < 50% of wild-type levels.

Material used.Description: Mitochondrial complex I activity was measured in HEK293 cells overexpressing NDUFAF1 variants.

Readout description.Result Description: Complex I activity reduced by 60% in cells with the p.Arg154Trp variant.
No detectable complex I activity in cells with the p.Tyr154* variant.

Biological replicates.Description: Four independent transfections were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each enzyme activity measurement was repeated twice.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type NDUFAF1 overexpression was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: HEK293 cells transfected with an empty vector were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: t-test with Bonferroni correction was used.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Mitochondrial complex I activity ≥ 80% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Mitochondrial complex I activity < 50% of wild-type levels.
